eu.wauz.wauzcore.system.instances

Class InstanceMobArena

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.wauz.wauzcore.system.instances.InstanceMobArena

  • public class InstanceMobArena
extends java.lang.Object
    An arena that spawns waves of mobs in an instance world.
    Author:
    Wauzmons

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int currentWave
      The current wave number.
      private int maximumWave
      The maximum wave number.
      private int mobsLeft
      How many mobs of the current wave are left.
      private java.util.List<java.util.List<MobSpawn>> waves
      The list of lists of mobs that spawn in arena waves.
      private org.bukkit.World world
      The instance world of the arena.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructs an arena, that is an exact copy of another arena.
      InstanceMobArena(java.lang.String instanceName)
      Creates an arena template, based on the instance file in the /WauzCore/InstanceData folder.

    • Constructor Detail

      • InstanceMobArena

        public InstanceMobArena(java.lang.String instanceName)
        Creates an arena template, based on the instance file in the /WauzCore/InstanceData folder.
        Parameters:
        instanceName - The name of the instance, the arena is located in.

      • InstanceMobArena

        public InstanceMobArena(InstanceMobArena arena,
                        org.bukkit.World world)
        Constructs an arena, that is an exact copy of another arena.
        Parameters:
        arena - The arena to clone.
        world - The instance world for the cloned arena.

    • Method Detail

      • tryToManuallyStartNewWave

        public void tryToManuallyStartNewWave(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Lets a player try to start a new wave manually. Only works when a set of 5 waves is completed and there are still waves left.
        Parameters:
        player - The player who tries to start the wave.
        See Also:
        startNewWave()

      • checkIfNewWaveShouldStart

        public void checkIfNewWaveShouldStart()
        Starts a new wave, if requirements are met. Broadcasts a message when all waves have been completed.
        See Also:
        startNewWave(), broadcastMessage(String, Sound)

      • startNewWave

        public void startNewWave()
        Increases the wave counter and spawns the mobs for the new wave. Also broadcasts a message to show the current wave number.
        See Also:
        MobSpawn.spawn(World), broadcastMessage(String, Sound), WauzPlayerScoreboard.scheduleScoreboardRefresh(Player)

      • broadcastMessage

        public void broadcastMessage(java.lang.String message,
                             org.bukkit.Sound sound)
        Broadcasts a title message with sound effect to all players in the arena.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to display.
        sound - The sound effect to play.

      • handOutMedals

        public void handOutMedals()
        Give every player in the arena a medal for completing the current wave.
        See Also:
        PlayerCollectionConfigurator.setCharacterMedals(Player, long)

      • tryToIncreaseMobCount

        public static void tryToIncreaseMobCount(org.bukkit.entity.Entity entity)
        If the given entity is part of a mob arena, the arena's mob count gets increased.
        Parameters:
        entity - The entity that could have appeared in an arena.

      • increaseMobCount

        public void increaseMobCount()
        Increases how many mobs are left in the current wave.

      • tryToDecreaseMobCount

        public static void tryToDecreaseMobCount(org.bukkit.entity.Entity entity)
        If the given entity is part of a mob arena, the arena's mob count gets decreased.
        Parameters:
        entity - The entity that could have disappeared from an arena.

      • decreaseMobCount

        public void decreaseMobCount()
        Decreases how many mobs are left in the current wave.
        See Also:
        checkIfNewWaveShouldStart()

      • getCurrentWave

        public int getCurrentWave()
        Returns:
        The current wave number.

      • setCurrentWave

        public void setCurrentWave(int currentWave)
        Parameters:
        currentWave - The new current wave number.

        Returns:
        The maximum wave number.

        Parameters:

        Parameters:
